metadata.Title: CVE-2021-32917 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Prosody before 0.11.9. The proxy65 component allows open access by default, even if neither of the users has an XMPP account on the local server, allowing unrestricted use of the server's bandwidth.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32917` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

prosody - 0.12.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: prosody package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.12.1-1').
